text: The Rakaposhi-Haramosh Mountains is a group of mountains in the Karakoram range. It was what is called a subrange, or a smaller mountain range inside of a larger one. It is located in Gilgit-Baltistan, in Pakistan. The Barpu and the Chogo Lungma Glaciers are the northern border for these mountains. In the east, the Shigar River is the border. The Gilgit and Indus Rivers form the border in the south. The Hunza River is the border in the west.Jerzy Wala, Orographical Sketch Map of the Karakoram, Swiss Foundation for Alpine Research, Zurich, 1990. The subrange is named after two mountains, Rakaposhi and Haramosh. These have some of the largest Topographic prominence in the world.Andy Fanshawe and Stephen Venables, Himalaya Alpine-Style, Hodder and Stoughton, 1995. == Selected peaks == Mountain Height (m) Height (ft) Coordinates Prominence (m) Parent mountain First ascent Ascents (attempts) Rakaposhi 7,788 25,551 2,818 K2 1958 8 (13) Malubiting 7,458 24,469 2,193 Rakaposhi 1971 2 (6) Haramosh 7,409 24,308 2,277 Malubiting 1958 4 (3) Diran 7,266 23,839 1,325 Malubiting 1968 12 (8) == Related pages == * List of highest mountains == References == == Other websites == * Category:Karakoram Category:Mountains of Gilgit-Baltistan
